SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc31
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.model.player

Class PlayArea

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.model.player.PlayArea
public class PlayArea extends Object
This class represents the play area of a player in the game. It manages the player's placed cards and achieved resources.

      Parameters:

    • checkRequirements

      private boolean checkRequirements(PlayableCard card)
      Checks if the player has enough resources to play the card.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to check.
      Returns:
      true if the player has enough resources, false otherwise.

    • place

      public int place(PlayableCard card, Point point) throws IllegalPlaceCardException
      Firstly it checks out if I have enough Resources to play the card. Then it adds the card in the placedCard Map if the function allowedMove return true. Then return the value of points gained from that card Notice that player will have to call: score += hisPlayArea.place(card, point) to add points at his score correctly
      Parameters:
      card - the card to place.
      point - the point to place the card at.
      Returns:
      the score gained from the card.
      Throws:
      IllegalPlaceCardException

    • allowedMove

      private boolean allowedMove(Point point)
      Return true if move is allowed, false if it is not. Refers to card placement rule only The algorithm starts with the idea that the move is ILLEGAL. It needs to check all four corners of already placed cards that it could be covering. If it finds at least one of those corners HIDDEN, then the move is ILLEGAL. If it finds at least one existing corner not HIDDEN, then it flags the move as POSSIBLE To return true it needs to have all four corners checked
      Parameters:
      point - the point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the move is allowed, false otherwise.

    • updateAvailableRes

      private void updateAvailableRes(PlayableCard card, Point point)
      Command update the value in the achievedResource map under the key (r) with its value +1 when adding resources (unless r == HIDDEN). Then it checks all the cards that could have been covered by the new placed card and update the value in the achievedResource map under the key (r) with its value -1. Notice that the condition of covering a not HIDDEN corner has already been checked (Method also calls coverCorner(int) to modify the card value)
      Parameters:
      card - the card that is placed.
      point - the point where the card is placed.

    • getPlacedCards

      public LinkedHashMap<Point,PlayableCard> getPlacedCards()
      Returns:
      a copy of the placed cards.

    • getAchievedResources

      public Map<Resources,Integer> getAchievedResources()
      Returns:
      a copy of the achieved resources.
